text: Hollister Pajotte (born 30 October 1976) is a former Trinidadian cricketer who played a single match for Trinidad and Tobago in West Indian domestic cricket. Pajotte was born in San Fernando, Trinidad.Hollister Pajotte – National Sporting Archives of Trinidad and Tobago. Retrieved 1 August 2016. His first and only match for Trinidad and Tobago came in October 2000, in a limited- overs match against the United States in the 2000–01 Red Stripe Bowl.List A matches played by Hollister Pajotte – CricketArchive. Retrieved 1 August 2016. Pajotte usually played as a wicket-keeper, but due to Keno Mason already taking the wicket-keeping gloves was instead selected solely as a batsman. He came in third in the batting order, after Lincoln Roberts and Andy Jackson, and scored four not out, after his team had earlier bowled their opponents out for just 62 runs.Trinidad and Tobago v United States of America, Red Stripe Bowl 2000/01 (Zone A) – CricketArchive. Retrieved 1 August 2016. Outside of cricket, Pajotte worked as a policeman. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1976 births Category:Living people Category:People from San Fernando, Trinidad and Tobago Category:Trinidad and Tobago cricketers
title: Hollister Pajotte
